content.title: Manual Compression Hemostasis
content.description: Traditional method of achieving hemostasis at arterial access sites through direct pressure application.

technique.positioning: Pressure applied 1-2cm proximal to skin puncture (over arterial puncture)
technique.pressure: Firm but not occlusive - should maintain distal pulses
technique.duration: 15-30 minutes for diagnostic, longer for larger sheaths or anticoagulation
technique.endpoints: Hemostasis achieved without hematoma or pseudoaneurysm

considerations.anticoagulation: May need to reverse or wait for ACT <180
considerations.patient_factors: Obesity, antiplatelet therapy, coagulopathy affect success
